name: Sheraton Tribeca New York Hotel

reviews.text: I just had a great stay at the Sheraton Tribeca. Loved the location on Canal St bt West Broadway and Wooster. Room was clean with big windows and light color interior. Seemed much more minimal in design compared to other Sheratons. Nice big shower. Club Lounge was open on the weekend and breakfast was served until 11am which is nice on a weekend. While I liked the location one must realize it is on the Tribeca/Soho line... I found it very close to Soho, Tribeca, West Village, NoLita and Chinatown.
reviews.title: Great Sheraton

reviews.text: Valet Parking is $55...
reviews.title: Great location, very clean

reviews.text: I loved the location!!! I liked being in walking distance to soho and the west village! Also the E train station is right across the street that will take you to JFK! I thought the room was very nice!! It was small but that is what you get in NYC! I liked that there was a loofah in the shower with shower gel!! Nice treat! I will defiantly go back!!
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel in Tribeca!

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 days to celebrate New Year and this hotel is a gem in Tribeca. Thanks to the efficient Mr. Tom Keane for his gracious accommodation given to our family. Also to Zakia David, and Javit (?) sorry if the spelling was wrong. We're glad we booked here instead of the crazy Times Square Hotels. The hotel has all the amenities we need, superb staff service from doormen to the front desk to the lounge staff. People here are friendly and so helpful. Soho has countless shops on sale and the Greenwich Village has good collection of reasonably priced CDs. Other famous landmarks are accessible. The view from the lounge balcony is fantastic!
reviews.title: Incredible
Great Price, Great Quality, No Complaints for a 1 Night Stay
reviews.text: Had no idea how fabulous this location is! Everything is in walking distant, even on a cold winter day! Tons of great restaurants and bars nearby. Was here for a wedding and the hotel staff was extremely accommodating and the price was great for the TriBeCa area. Great for all people!!

Positives: Clean hotel and no bed bugs! This hotel has a great location and helpful reception staff. We got a good deal on booking.com. Rooms were pretty spacious compared to other hotels in Manhattan. Negatives: hidden charges were a nasty surprise at check out, and the cleaning staff were rather aggressive asking for tips. Parking is a ripoff - we did it one night and then managed to find free parking in Manhattan! Maybe we were just lucky, but parking was definitely not as hard to figure out as in other major cities.
reviews.title: sheraton on Canal St. New York City

reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel with reasonable rates (for New York) and within walking distance (about one mile) to Wall St. and 9/11 Memorial. The hotel is new, so the rooms are relatively large, clean and modern. Platinum members get access to the club lounge which has a good breakfast and fair hors dourves. The location is nice too - with lots of souvenir shops/vendors. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: I had a family crisis and needed to cancel our Christmastime trip the evening before it was to start. I called Sheraton central, was told it was less than 24 hours before arrival so they couldn't give a refund, but in the morning I should call the hotel directly. So I did -- NO HELP WHATSOEVER. No, they couldn't refund me anything at all. No, they couldn't apply it to a future stay instead. I spent my $300 and lost it.
reviews.title: Warning: they bite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know I was looking for an exception to a rule I'd agreed to up-front... but not even credit towards a future stay? If their argument is that they couldn't give the room to someone else that night, it's true, but that only means they lost their profit -- they didn't have to provide any service, make any beds, leave any shampoo bottles. I wasn't even refunded the high NYC taxes on the stay we didn't have.
reviews.title: Good Overnight Stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It seems telling that the person who "handled" my situation (i.e. blew it off) was the "Director of Revenue", not somebody focusing on customer satisfaction. Call me 0% satisfied. When we finally take that postponed NYC trip in a couple more weeks, why on earth would I choose the Sheraton? The chain has lost my business forever over one day's inflexibility.
reviews.title: Sheraton Tribeca- Off the Beaten Path Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Tribeca Sheraton in early december. The hotel was in a great location, just blocks from amazing shopping in SoHo, and very close to a subway stop. The staff was very friendly and helpful. There were two that we had the most contact with, David and Michael, and they were both wonderful. The room we had was small but not too small. The bathroom was very nice and the bed was extremely comfortable. This was our first trip to New York City, and we will definitely stay at this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Great experience at the Sheraton in Tribeca

reviews.text: The only thing I did not like was the (about) $10/day for internet. But, we were rarely in our room so it wasn't a huge deal.
reviews.title: Not what I expected from a Sheraton, location not the best

reviews.text: Attracted to the hotel due to the reviews, location, price and name Sheraton. However this did not live up to Sheraton expectations. When I checked in the room I requested was not available so I was moved to a room for the physically challenged which had no bath. Whilst it is claimed this is right in trendy Tribeca, it is not in the nice part of Tribeca, the hotel is right on canal street and right in the middle of the area where people hustling and harrassing you trying to sell you fake louis vuittons from garbage bags. Also full of tacky souvenier and electronic shops, whilst I felt safe I would not stay here with children. The concierge was helpful however now on reflection and after reading some reviews post event, I think the concierge actually over charges, eg my ticket to warhorse $139 + the same again as a 'brokers fee'. If you are travelling at a quiet time of day take the subway or a normal NYC cab to the airport the hotel cab is a rip off at + $100. Internet charge was $9.95 per day, yet when I checked out I had been charged multiple times multiple days. No mini bar and room service till only 11pm, I expected more from a sheraton. On the plus side, on site starbucks and possibly the most comfortable bed I have slept in. World Trade Centre is only a 20 minute walk, Times Square, Central Park in good traffic 15 mins in a cab.
reviews.title: Solid hotel

reviews.text: Spent a long weekend with my mom and daughter (10) in this city hotel. Was all I would expect from a sheraton. Clean bathrooms, comfortable beds, and a good sized room. In this hotel you get a good value for your money. NYC hotel rooms tend to be very small, unless you spend a fortune.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Breakfast as ok, nothing fancy.
reviews.title: Very good value for money, great location and very friendly, helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time Sheraton NY. we have stayed at other sheratons and got decent value for money esp on booking.com etc. in NY value for money over holiday period is impossible, this sheraton has daily rates and lots of city/room taxes, NYeve day rate was 899 dollars, day after 250.. be warned they will hit with every tax going. in fact we paid 700 dollars in New York city taxes. wow.
reviews.title: Club Lounge Cloudtastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: money aside this is great hotel, yeah the rooms are hotel rooms big double bed, shower, tea-coffee, freenewspaper, ice vending, roomservice, cleaners daily, higher up you stay, great views and if you are savvy get club lounge access on your deal. this entitles you to go to the 21st floor open terrace(of course indoor part too) for breakfast(not bad at all bar the sausages) and evening drinks with views of the new yor skyline inc empire state building that you will pay 30dollars for at top of the rock etc. in fact you can access this space at all times. it is also fully staffed.
reviews.title: Room for improvment

reviews.text: the staff here at the tribeca were aweseome, great team effort , friendly, go the extra yard for you, good advice, good conversation if your sports fan, basically they make this hotel what it is. yes they want tipping but not all do and for those that dont know, they are taxed on all there tips even cash ones.
reviews.title: Super comfortable base camp for exploring the city
don't stay here
reviews.text: wifi in room you have to pay for 10dollars for 24hrs or in the lobby free, plenty of computers to use and a starbucks in reception. great bar, tasty drinks,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: please ensure you ask for your bill prior to departure and ask for copies all receipts you sign. there are those in NY who will add to your bill if do not put a line through sections of receipts. (good tip that)
reviews.title: Great mini-vacation!
